channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Israel's classified military plans for Gaza. And, defining "buy-now, pay-later" loans
item.description: Israel is considering plans for a full-scale ground invasion of Gaza within a few months. And, examining the pros and cons of "buy-now, pay-later" loans.
item.content:encoded:
Israel is considering plans for a full-scale ground invasion of Gaza within a few months. And, examining the pros and cons of "buy-now, pay-later" loans.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Reporter's notebook: 8 theories why fentanyl deaths are plummeting
item.description: Some 30,000 fewer people are dying every year in the U.S. from fentanyl and other street drugs. This shift has stunned addiction experts, reversing decades of rising death.
item.content:encoded:
Some 30,000 fewer people are dying every year in the U.S. from fentanyl and other street drugs. This shift has stunned addiction experts, reversing decades of rising death.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Things people forget to clean the most, according to cleaning experts
item.description: Kyshawn Lane of Weekly Home Check and Dana K. White, author of Decluttering at the Speed of Life, share their top house cleaning hacks and tips.
item.content:encoded:
Kyshawn Lane of Weekly Home Check and Dana K. White, author of Decluttering at the Speed of Life, share their top house cleaning hacks and tips.

(Image credit: Carol Yepes)
item.dc:creator: Kaity Kline

item.title: Could legal weed make you sick? Here's how California tries to keep it safe
item.description: With no help from the federal government, states are trying to regulate recreational marijuana. California's Department of Cannabis Control works to keep contaminants out of joints, vapes and edibles.
item.content:encoded:
With no help from the federal government, states are trying to regulate recreational marijuana. California's Department of Cannabis Control works to keep contaminants out of joints, vapes and edibles.

(Image credit: Preston Gannaway for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Israel's latest war plans: to occupy Gaza and rule Palestinians
item.description: Occupying Gaza and establishing military rule there would go beyond Israel's stated war goals to end Hamas rule and free hostages captured in the Oct. 7, 2023 attack.
item.content:encoded:
Occupying Gaza and establishing military rule there would go beyond Israel's stated war goals to end Hamas rule and free hostages captured in the Oct. 7, 2023 attack.

(Image credit: Abdel Kareem Hana)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Dreams of a three-peat come crashing at the NCAA basketball tournament
item.description: Florida ends UConn's bid to repeat — again — in Sunday action that saw a memorable buzzer-beater. Meanwhile, South Carolina advances in the women's tournament, which rounds out its Sweet 16 on Monday.
item.content:encoded:
Florida ends UConn's bid to repeat — again — in Sunday action that saw a memorable buzzer-beater. Meanwhile, South Carolina advances in the women's tournament, which rounds out its Sweet 16 on Monday.

(Image credit: Jared C. Tilton)
item.dc:creator: Greg Echlin

item.title: One family. One attack. 132 names. A Gaza investigation
item.description: More than 50,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's war with Hamas, Gaza health officials say. We reconstructed what happened in one of the deadliest Israeli strikes of the war.
item.content:encoded:
More than 50,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's war with Hamas, Gaza health officials say. We reconstructed what happened in one of the deadliest Israeli strikes of the war.

(Image credit: Mahmoud Rehan)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: 'Twain hated bullies.' Conan O'Brien receives Mark Twain Prize at the Kennedy Center
item.description: Comedian Conan O'Brien received the Mark Twain Prize at the Kennedy Center on Sunday night, which David Letterman called "the most entertaining gathering of the resistance ever."
item.content:encoded:
Comedian Conan O'Brien received the Mark Twain Prize at the Kennedy Center on Sunday night, which David Letterman called "the most entertaining gathering of the resistance ever."

(Image credit: Clifton Prescod for Netflix)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: TikTok is full of ADHD advice — just don't trust it for a diagnosis
item.description: TikTok has become the go-to source on ADHD for teens and young adults. But a new study finds that a lot of the information is misleading and can make people's symptoms worse.
item.content:encoded:
TikTok has become the go-to source on ADHD for teens and young adults. But a new study finds that a lot of the information is misleading and can make people's symptoms worse.

(Image credit: Amr Bo Shanab)
item.dc:creator: Will Stone

item.title: South Korean court reinstates impeached PM Han Duck-soo as acting leader
item.description: Many observers said Monday's ruling on Han Duck-soo doesn't signal much on the upcoming verdict on President Yoon Suk Yeol, as Han wasn't a key figure in Yoon's martial law imposition.
item.content:encoded:
Many observers said Monday's ruling on Han Duck-soo doesn't signal much on the upcoming verdict on President Yoon Suk Yeol, as Han wasn't a key figure in Yoon's martial law imposition.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
